page.title: 05ARMED FORCES
page.content: Browndown Training Camp is a barren stretch of scrub-covered shingle covering a large area of landscape. The earliest records of Browndown atthe latter end of the 18th Century were of deserted heathlands between the villages of Alverstoke and Titchfield. At the beginning of the l9th century French prisoners of war made the first stop butts for a musketry range. Curiously this barren area was also a favourite place for people ofthe district to come and kill themselves or others. The last fatal duel in England was fought here between Lieutenant Henry Charles Moorehead-Hawkey,Royal Marines and James Alexander Seaton of the llth Dragoon Guards.
